content:
Based on the execution logs, I'll create a report summarizing the existing structures and error tips.

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line (Position x=0.0-2.0, y=0.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces working in parallel:
- Furnace 1 at position(0.0, 0.0) 
- Furnace 2 at position(2.0, 0.0)
Both furnaces are processing iron ore into iron plates and are coal-powered

### Copper Plate Production (Position x=4.0, y=4.0)
Single stone furnace dedicated to copper plate production:
- Furnace 3 at position(4.0, 4.0), coal-powered

### Iron Gear Wheel Assembly Line (Position x=6.5-12.5, y=11.5)
Automated assembly line consisting of:
- Input chest at position(6.5, 11.5) storing iron plates
- Input burner inserter at position(7.5, 11.5)
- Assembling machine at position(9.5, 11.5) crafting iron gear wheels
- Output burner inserter at position(11.5, 11.5)
- Output chest at position(12.5, 11.5) storing finished iron gear wheels

### Power Generation System (Position x=-9.5 to -2.5, y=22.5-24.5)
Steam-based power system consisting of:
- Offshore pump at position(-9.5, 24.5)
- Pipe network connecting water flow
- Boiler at position(-7.0, 24.5)
- Steam engine at position(-2.5, 24.5)
- Electric pole network connecting power to facilities

### Research Facility
- Lab researching Logistics technology, connected to the power grid

ERROR TIPS

### Resource shortage errors
- Check inventory before attempting to insert items into machines
- Ensure you have the required resources before attempting insertion operations (coal for boiler, iron ore for furnaces)

### Recipe requirement errors
- Ensure all recipe ingredients are available before starting assembly operations
- For iron gear wheel production, maintain adequate iron plate supply in the assembler input

### Inventory management
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters and boilers
- Keep track of raw material supplies (iron ore, copper ore, coal) and harvest when running low
